text: An ice shelf is a large platform of ice, where a glacier flows down to a coastline. An ice shelf is usually very thick, usually or more. Some ice shelves float on the water. Ice shelves that float are usually much thinner. The biggest areas of ice shelf are in Antarctica: *Ross Ice Shelf , as of 2013 *Filchner-Ronne Ice Shelf, ==Other websites== Category:Bodies of water Category:Ice
title: Ice shelf
